cluster_relations.rel_desc: The essay states it will explore the origins of urban legends as one of its main topics.
The question of the existence of the supernatural is explicitly concerned with whether supernatural phenomena are real.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: CognitiveState: audience speculation prompted by tales

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (a text, question, discourse, or conceptual focus) is about or thematically concerned with the object topic.
args.justification: Both relations describe an aboutness/topic relation: an essay being about the origins of urban legends and a question being about the supernatural. They share the same semantic predicate of thematic focus, so they should be normalized to a single canonical predicate 'is_about'.
Both instances encode that a discourse or conceptual inquiry is thematically directed toward a topic, which is best captured as an aboutness/topic family of relations.

Aboutness expresses a non-physical, thematic association between a discourse (essay, question) and a topic concept rather than composition, causality, or spatiality, so it fits best under a broad ASSOCIATION group.

They share the same semantic predicate of thematic focus, so they should be normalized to a single canonical predicate 'is_about'.
Both instances encode that a discourse or conceptual inquiry is thematically directed toward a topic, which is best captured as an aboutness/topic family of relations.

Aboutness expresses a non-physical, thematic association between a discourse (essay, question) and a topic concept rather than composition, causality, or spatiality, so it fits best under a broad ASSOCIATION group.
